people to be one of the most important scientific writings of the past Century

couple of thousand uh words out of those letter combinations Don uh found 4500
and won the won the competition um he uh went to college uh what is now Case
Western Reserve University for his undergraduate work and he initially actually planned to study music in
college he's quite as me I'm sure all of you know he's quite an accomplished musician and plays uh the organ uh the
tube of the saxophone and I think several other instruments as well and The Story Goes that one day uh he was on
his way to um band practice and he missed the bus and so uh waiting for the
next bus to arrive uh he actually unraveled an extra credit math problem that was so difficult in the math class
that the professor teaching the class that said that uh if anybody could Solve IT they'd get an anomic A in the class
and so uh he solved it what he was waiting for the next bus and that turned into him becoming a math major with the
highest GPA of any of the math Majors uh in his class in um 1963 uh don earned his PhD
degree from Caltech in mathematics and not long after that he joined the computer science faculty here at
Stanford um he taught here unbelievably successfully for many years and and then decided he wanted it to vote full-time
to working on his books and so he retired from the University and he now spends as you know his his full-time
writing uh writing his books but he we still see him on campus writing his bike around and he still gives lectures on
campus and is is still a great friend of all of us in engineering and in computer science he's obviously received uh

to honor him and to recognize him and Don we have for you it's a slight token
